title: World-Wide
text:
The executive board of the IMF said it has full confidence in Georgieva as its managing director, ending weeks of uncertainty while the board investigated her role in a data-manipulation scandal at the World Bank .

---

Shiite cleric Moqtada al-Sadr was poised to become Iraq's key political power broker after his movement won the largest share of seats in parliamentary elections.

---

An Afghan interpreter who helped rescue then-Sen. Biden in 2008 when his helicopter made an emergency landing in Afghanistan has escaped from the country.

---

Merck and partner Ridgeback said they filed an application asking the FDA to authorize their Covid-19 pill, the next step toward adding a long-sought drug for use at home.

---

Texas businesses and other private entities are now banned from requiring Covid-19 vaccinations for employees, Gov. Abbott said in an executive order.

---

The Nobel in economics went to David Card, Joshua D. Angrist and Guido W. Imbens for their work on natural experiments, in particular their contributions to better understanding how the job market works.
